q: In Oracle, which of the following profiles allows a user to have a maximum of four failed login attempts and lock their account for a period of 30 days after exceeding the maximum failed login attempts?
In Oracle, if the AUDIT_TRAIL parameter is set to OS, then which of the following statements is incorrect?

a.option: The Windows operating system writes audit records as events to the application event log.
You are not allowed to specify the AUDIT_FILE_DEST initialization parameter for Windows platforms.

In some operating systems, an audit record for instance connection and database startup is always logged to the default location $ORACLE_HOME/rdbms/audit regardless of the setting of AUDIT_FILE_DEST parameter.
There is no default value for initializing AUDIT_FILE_DEST parameter.

q: In Oracle, which of the following commands is used to disable the AUDIT statement?
In Oracle, which of the following tables is used to store the database of audit trail records?
In Oracle, encrypting a password is very important for the security of a database and its data. Which of the following routines will you use to encrypt a password while verifying a connection?

a.option: Set the ORA_ENCRYPT_LOGIN environment variable to TRUE on the client machine
Set the DBLINK_ENCRYPT_LOGIN server initialization parameter to TRUE

q: In Oracle, which of the following operations is not audited by default?

a.option: Connections to the instance with administrator privileges
